alert.note: Alert for Mora (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 22 at 2:50PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall over the southern portion of the Cook`s Peak burn scar near Ocate is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast New Mexico, including the following county, Mora. * WHEN...Until 600 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 248 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.25 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Wheaten Creek, Ocate Creek and Banderitas Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of North Central Mora County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Runoff from rainfall will cause elevated water levels within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of the southern portion of the Cook`s Peak fire burn area.
